topics.body: . . . . Uggghhhhh. . . I know I've joked about being a evil movie villain, but this actually done in reality is kind of sickening.  If you're wondering what I mean by this is that special interest groups have found a new way of pushing their interests:  "funding" schools.  What I mean by this is that the newest trend is to basically spend money towards a school and push their agenda on children in class.

topics.body: I was thinking. A fossil costing $394 US dollars total (including shipping) would have a total import duty cost of about 111.03 NZ dollars. If I buy something online costing that much in import tax, am I supposed to pay it to the seller or do I pay it to someone else when the item enters the country?
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c70abf636872062bc90000#post_53c70abf636872062bc90000
They're over-estimating the effect and not spending it well though.  A much more effective use of that money would be to do this solely in swing states and in school districts leaning towards opposing political ideologies.  That would have a much more real effect.

Right now the problem with the plan is that if everyone's starting to do it then the effect it'll have as a whole will get diluted.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
